en_literal: The hunger is the best cook.
Morning hour has gold in the mouth.
en_correct: The early bird catches the worm.

lu_part1: Wann den Hond net geschass hätt,
en_literal: If the dog hadn't pooped, he would have caught the hare.
en_correct: If 'ifs' and 'ands' were pots and pans.

en_literal: A good donkey bumps himself only once.
en_correct: A wise man only makes a mistake once.

en_literal: In the need, the devil eats flies.
No master has fallen from the sky yet.
How one beds oneself, so one lies.
en_correct: You've made your bed, now lie in it.

en_literal: Everything has an end, only the sausage has two.
en_correct: All good things must come to an end.

lu_part1: Wann et dem Iesel ze gutt geet,
en_literal: When the donkey feels too good, he goes dancing on the ice.

lu_part1: E gëtt näischt sou reng gesponnen,
en_literal: Nothing is spun so fine that it doesn't come to the sun.
The more one has, the more one wants.
